{"step_by_step_thinking": "Miglitol is an oral anti-diabetic drug that acts by inhibiting the ability of the patient to break down complex carbohydrates into glucose. Complex carbohydrates are broken down into glucose through the cleavage of glycosidic bonds. Therefore, when a patient takes miglitol, glycosidic bonds will no longer be cleaved.", "answer_choice": "B. Glycosidic bonds"}
